ANALOGY.Defintion: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea

AUTHORITARIAN.Defintion: demanding that people obey completely and refusing to allow them freedom to act as they wish

BROADLY.Defintion: in a general way, without considering specific examples or all the details

BROWSE.Defintion: look at things on the internet

BROWSER.Defintion: a computer programme that makes it possible for you to read information on the internet

BROWSING.Defintion: to look at information on the internet

CONCURRENT.Defintion: happening or existing at the same time

CONDEMNED.Defintion: criticise something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons

ENABLE.Defintion: to make someone able to do something, or to make something possible

ENABLES.Defintion: to make someone able to do something, or to make something possible

ENCRYPTED.Defintion: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

ENCRYPTION.Defintion: the process of changing electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use without special equipment

EXPOSE.Defintion: to make public something bad or dishonest

FAUSTIAN PACT.Defintion: A pact whereby a person trades something of supreme moral or spiritual importance, such as personal values or the soul, for some worldly or material benefit, such as knowledge, power, or riches

FIREARMS.Defintion: guns that can be carried easily

IDEOLOGICAL.Defintion: based on or relating to a particular set of ideas or beliefs

INTERFERE.Defintion: to involve yourself in a situation when your involvement is not wanted or is not helpful

JUMP TO THE CONCLUSION.Defintion: to guess the facts about a situation without having enough information

LAYER.Defintion: one of several different levels in a complicated organisation, system, set of ideas

LAYERS.Defintion: one of several different levels in a complicated organisation, system, set of ideas

MALPRACTICE.Defintion: failure to act correctly or legally when doing your job, often causing injury or loss

MASTERMIND.Defintion: to plan a difficult activity, often a crime, in detail and make certain that it happens successfully

MISINTERPRET.Defintion: to form an understanding that is not correct of something that is said or done

PARALLEL.Defintion: something very similar to something else, or a similarity between two things

PUBLIC DOMAIN.Defintion: if information is in the public domain, it is available for everyone to see or know about

PURPOSE.Defintion: why you do something or why something exists

REPRISALS.Defintion: (an example of) activity against another person, especially as a punishment by military forces or a political group

SHADY.Defintion: sheltered from direct light from the sun

SNOOPING.Defintion: to look around a place secretly, in order to discover things or find out information about someone or something

THE LATTER.Defintion: the second of two people, things, or groups previously mentioned

THIRD PARTIES.Defintion: a third person or organisation less directly involved in a matter than the main people or organisations that are involved

TRACE.Defintion: to find the origin of something

TRACEABLE.Defintion: possible to find or follow, especially using technology

TRACED.Defintion: to find someone or something that was lost

TRANSPARENCY.Defintion: a situation in which business and financial activities are done in an open way without secrets, so that people can trust that they are fair and honest

WHISTLEBLOWER.Defintion: a person who tells someone in authority about something illegal that is happening, especially in a government department or a company

WHISTLEBLOWERS.Defintion: a person who tells someone in authority about something illegal that is happening, especially in a government department or a company
